bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: Trying to upgrade qterminal, it pulls qtermwidget package. However, the previous version pulled qtermwidget-qt5 and this collides.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): qtermwidget-0.7.1-1.fc26
How reproducible: always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. dnf upgrade https://kojipkgs.fedoraproject.org//packages/qterminal/0.7.1/2.fc26/x86_64/qterminal-0.7.1-2.fc26.x86_64.rpm
Actual results: Last metadata expiration check: 0:00:27 ago on Mon Apr 24 09:27:07 2017 CEST. Dependencies resolved.  Package Arch Version Repository Size  Upgrading: qterminal x86_64 0.7.1-2.fc26 @commandline 150 k Installing dependencies: qtermwidget x86_64 0.7.1-1.fc26 updates-testing 219 k
Transaction Summary  Install 1 Package Upgrade 1 Package
Total size: 369 k Is this ok [y/N]: y Downloading Packages: [SKIPPED] qtermwidget-0.7.1-1.fc26.x86_64.rpm: Already downloaded Running transaction check Transaction check succeeded. Running transaction test The downloaded packages were saved in cache until the next successful transaction. You can remove cached packages by executing 'dnf clean packages'. Error: Transaction check error: file /usr/lib64/libqtermwidget5.so.0 from install of qtermwidget-0.7.1-1.fc26.x86_64 conflicts with file from package qtermwidget-qt5-0.6.0-5.fc26.x86_64
Error Summary -------------
Expected results: no such error - qtermwidget-0.7.1 provides qtermwidget-qt5 and obsoletes qtermwidget-qt5 < 0.7.0
Additional info:

Already fixed with qtermwidget-0.7.1-2.fc26: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-ec98e192d4
I made a small mistake in first build...

lxqt-l10n-0.11.2-6.fc26 qt-virt-manager-0.42.67-3.fc26 qterminal-0.7.1-2.fc26 qtermwidget-0.7.1-2.fc26 qtermwidget-qt4-0.6.0-2.fc26 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 26. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-ec98e192d4

cool, thanks
for some reason I've missed this qtermwidget build while I have found the newer (-2) qterminal ... I see it was submitted today, but after I have looked, probably some sync issue? - never mind
Yes, I wanted to get new qtermwidget build in earlier, was a bit affected by the outage on Friday/Saturday.

lxqt-l10n-0.11.2-6.fc26, qt-virt-manager-0.42.67-3.fc26, qterminal-0.7.1-2.fc26, qtermwidget-0.7.1-2.fc26, qtermwidget-qt4-0.6.0-2.fc26 has been pushed to the Fedora 26 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-ec98e192d4

lxqt-l10n-0.11.2-6.fc26, qt-virt-manager-0.42.67-3.fc26, qterminal-0.7.1-2.fc26, qtermwidget-0.7.1-2.fc26, qtermwidget-qt4-0.6.0-2.fc26 has been pushed to the Fedora 26 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
